snippet: Abu Qatada, regarded by British officials as one of Al Qaeda’s main inspirational leaders in Europe, was let out of prison in February after a court blocked his deportation to Jordan.
abstract: British authorities rearrest Omar Mahmoud Mohammed Othman, radical Muslim cleric who was released from prison in February after a European court overruled British judges and blocked his deportation to Jordan on terrorism charges; authorities announce that they plan to resume efforts to remove Othman from Britain.

byline.original: By RAVI SOMAIYA and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: Abu Qatada, regarded by British officials as one of Al Qaeda’s main inspirational leaders in Europe, was let out of prison in February after a court blocked his deportation to Jordan.

headline.main: Britain Arrests Muslim Cleric, Again Seeking Deportation
headline.print_headline: Britain Starts New Attempt To Deport Radical Cleric
